A clearinghouse for media, petitions, and other events related to organizing against injustice at Indiana University Bloomington.

IUB Organizing Hub

News & Updates

Whitten/Shrivastav Invite Snipers and State Troopers To Campus

A long-standing policy on protest guidelines was changed in a closed-door meeting on April 24, less than 24 hours before the start of a scheduled protest. The policy change was used to justify the presence of state police on IU Bloomington’s campus and the arrest of more than 50 students and faculty on April 25 and 27. Year-long bans were meted out to those arrested. Read more…

Vote of No Confidence

An April 16 all-faculty meeting resulted in votes of no confidence for 3 high-level IU administrators. View no-confidence news and read the timeline of grievances below.

Timeline of Grievances

Inviting Snipers & Police to Campus

Apr 2024

A long-standing policy on protest guidelines was changed in a closed-door meeting on April 24, less than 24 hours before the start of a scheduled protest. The policy change was used to justify the presence of state police on IU Bloomington’s campus and the arrest of more than 50 students and faculty on April 25 and 27. Year-long bans were meted out to those arrested. (read more...)

Cancelling Samia Halaby

Jan 2024

Palestinian artist, activist, and educator Samia Halaby's first retrospective exhibition in the U.S. is cancelled by Indiana University, citing 'safety and security,'' as well as Halaby's Instagram posts advocating for Palestinian liberation. (read more...)

Suspending Abdulkader Sinno

Jan 2024

In direct response to Sinno's role as advisor of IUB's Palestinian Solidarity Committee, the university suspended him for the Spring/Summer 2024 semesters for holding an event to support Palestinians. (read more...)

Political Incursions on Academic Freedom

Nov 2023

Indiana Senate Bill 202 would undermine tenure and put IU under stricter political control. This follows the November 2023 letter to IUB from Jim Banks, pressuring them to curb academic freedoms in response to protests for Palestinian liberation. IUB's administration seems to acquiesce. (read more...)

Shuttering the Kinsey Institute

Apr 2023

In April 2023, the Indiana General Assembly voted to ban providing funds to the historic and world famous Kinsey Institute, one of the originators of the study of sexuality. (read more...)

Undermining Faculty Governance at IUI (formerly IUPUI)

Jun 2023

Using the breakup of IUPUI as justification, Pamela Whitten and IU's administration undermine tenure at the institution, putting dozens of professors at risk. (read more...)

Attacking Dr. Caitlin Barnard

Jul 2022

Following the US Supreme Court’s Striking down of Roe v. Wade, Dr. Caitlin Barnard is harassed by the AG for providing an abortion to a 10 year old, sparking a national controversy. (read more...)

Denying the Grad Student Union

Apr 2022

The administration refused to recognize the graduate students' union, the IGWC, even after an overwhelming vote by the faculty in favor of doing so. (read more...)

Terminating Mark McPhail

Sep 2021

False accusations made and university procedures violated to eliminate a troublesome professor. (read more...)

iub-organizing-collective

This site acts as a hub for news, media, petitions, and events around injustice on the campus of Indiana University Bloomington (IUB). This site is collectively managed by the Indiana University Bloomington Organizing Collective (IUB-OC), a loosely affiliated group composed of faculty, graduate students, undergraduates, and alumni from IUB.
